Home > external > kegg > getRxnsFromKEGG.m

getRxnsFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getRxnsFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

DESCRIPTION 

 getRxnsFromKEGG
   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database

   Input:
   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database

   Output:
   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
                       following fields are filled
       id                  'KEGG'
       description         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
                           expression is saved as the id
       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
                           associated to
       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
       ub                  1000 for all reactions
       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
                           reactions present in pathway maps the
                           reversibility is taken from there
       b                   0 for all metabolites
   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "spontaneous"
   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
                       undefined stoichiometry
   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "general reaction"

   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.

   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-01-08


 NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file

 ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
 NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
 DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
 EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
 REMARK      Same as: R06103
 RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
 ENZYME      3.2.1.28
 PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
 ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
 DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
 ///

 The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
 (except for '///')

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0002     isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0003 % getRxnsFromKEGG
0004 %   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database
0005 %
0006 %   Input:
0007 %   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
0008 %                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
0009 %                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
0010 %                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database
0011 %
0012 %   Output:
0013 %   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
0014 %                       following fields are filled
0015 %       id                  'KEGG'
0016 %       description         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
0017 %       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
0018 %       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
0019 %       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
0020 %                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
0021 %                           expression is saved as the id
0022 %       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
0023 %       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
0024 %                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
0025 %                           associated to
0026 %       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
0027 %       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
0028 %       ub                  1000 for all reactions
0029 %       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
0030 %                           reactions present in pathway maps the
0031 %                           reversibility is taken from there
0032 %       b                   0 for all metabolites
0033 %   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0034 %                       "spontaneous"
0035 %   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
0036 %                       undefined stoichiometry
0037 %   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0038 %                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
0039 %   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0040 %                       "general reaction"
0041 %
0042 %   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
0043 %   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
0044 %   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
0045 %   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
0046 %   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
0047 %   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.
0048 %
0049 %   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0050 %    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0051 %
0052 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-01-08
0053 %
0054 %
0055 % NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file
0056 %
0057 % ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
0058 % NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
0059 % DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
0060 % EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
0061 % REMARK      Same as: R06103
0062 % RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
0063 % ENZYME      3.2.1.28
0064 % PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
0065 %             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
0066 % ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
0067 % DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
0068 % ///
0069 %
0070 % The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
0071 % (except for '///')
0072 %
0073 
0074 if nargin<1
0075     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0076 end
0077 
0078 %Check if the reactions have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
0079 %model
0080 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0081 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0082 rxnsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat');
0083 if exist(rxnsFile, 'file')
0084     fprintf(['NOTE: Importing KEGG reactions from ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') '.\n']);
0085     load(rxnsFile);
0086 else
0087     fprintf(['Cannot locate ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') ' and will try to generate it from the local KEGG database.\n']);
0088     if ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'),'file')
0089         EM=fprintf(['The files ''reaction'', ''reaction.lst'' and ''reaction_mapformula.lst'' cannot be located at ' strrep(keggPath,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0090         dispEM(EM);
0091     else
0092         %Add new functionality in the order specified in models
0093         model.id='KEGG';
0094         model.description='Automatically generated from KEGG database';
0095         
0096         %Preallocate memory for 11000 reactions
0097         model.rxns=cell(11000,1);
0098         model.rxnNames=cell(11000,1);
0099         model.eccodes=cell(11000,1);
0100         model.subSystems=cell(11000,1);
0101         model.rxnMiriams=cell(11000,1);
0102         model.rxnNotes=cell(11000,1);
0103         equations=cell(11000,1);
0104         %Temporarily store the equations
0105         
0106         isSpontaneous=false(11000,1);
0107         isIncomplete=false(11000,1);
0108         isGeneral=false(11000,1);
0109 
0110         %First load information on reaction ID, reaction name, KO, pathway,
0111         %and ec-number
0112         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'), 'r');
0113         
0114         %Keep track of how many reactions that have been added
0115         rxnCounter=0;
0116         
0117         %Loop through the file
0118         orthology=false;
0119         pathway=false;
0120         module=false;
0121         while 1
0122             %Get the next line
0123             tline = fgetl(fid);
0124             
0125             %Abort at end of file
0126             if ~ischar(tline)
0127                 break;
0128             end
0129             
0130             %Skip '///'
0131             if numel(tline)<12
0132                 continue;
0133             end
0134             
0135             %Check if it's a new reaction
0136             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0137                 rxnCounter=rxnCounter+1;
0138                 
0139                 %Add empty strings where there should be such
0140                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}='';
0141                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}='';
0142                 model.subSystems{rxnCounter}='';
0143                 model.rxnNotes{rxnCounter}='';
0144                 equations{rxnCounter}='';
0145                 
0146                 %Add reaction ID (always 6 characters)
0147                 model.rxns{rxnCounter}=tline(13:18);
0148                 orthology=false;
0149                 pathway=false;
0150                 module=false;
0151                 
0152                 %Add KEGG reaction ID miriam;
0153                 tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0154                 tempStruct.name{1,1}='kegg.reaction';
0155                 tempStruct.value{1,1}=tline(13:18);
0156                 model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0157             end
0158             
0159             %Add name
0160             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'NAME        ')
0161                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0162             end
0163             
0164             %Add whether the comment includes "incomplete", "erroneous" or
0165             %"unclear"
0166             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'COMMENT     ')
0167                 %Read all text until '///', 'RPAIR', 'ENZYME', 'PATHWAY' or 'RCLASS'
0168                 commentText=tline(13:end);
0169                 while 1
0170                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0171                     if ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'///') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RPA') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'ENZ') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'PAT') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RCL')
0172                         commentText=[commentText ' ' strtrim(tline)];
0173                     else
0174                         break;
0175                     end
0176                 end
0177                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'SPONTANEOUS'))
0178                     %It should start this way
0179                     isSpontaneous(rxnCounter)=true;
0180                 end
0181                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'INCOMPLETE')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'ERRONEOUS')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'UNCLEAR'))
0182                     isIncomplete(rxnCounter)=true;
0183                 end
0184                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'GENERAL REACTION'))
0185                     %It should start this way
0186                     isGeneral(rxnCounter)=true;
0187                 end
0188                 
0189                 %Go to next iteration if it is '///'
0190                 if numel(tline)<12
0191                     continue;
0192                 end
0193             end
0194             
0195             %Add ec-number
0196             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENZYME      ')
0197                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0198                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=deblank(model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0199                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=strcat('ec-code/',model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0200                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=regexprep(model.eccodes{rxnCounter},'\s+',';ec-code/');
0201             end
0202             if numel(tline)>8
0203                 if strcmp(tline(1:9),'REFERENCE')
0204                     pathway=false;
0205                     orthology=false;
0206                 end
0207             end
0208             
0209             %Add module ids
0210             if numel(tline)>18
0211                 if strcmp(tline(1:12),'MODULE      ') || module==true
0212                     pathway=false;
0213                     orthology=false;
0214                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0215                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0216                     else
0217                         addToIndex=1;
0218                     end
0219                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0220                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.module';
0221                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0222                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0223                 end
0224             end
0225             
0226             %Add RHEA id
0227             if numel(tline)>18
0228                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'DBLINKS     RHEA: ')
0229                     pathway=false;
0230                     orthology=false;
0231                     module=false;
0232                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0233                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0234                     else
0235                         addToIndex=1;
0236                     end
0237                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0238                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='rhea';
0239                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:end);
0240                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0241                 end
0242             end
0243             
0244             %Add KO-ids
0245             if numel(tline)>16
0246                 if strcmp(tline(1:16),'ORTHOLOGY   KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:16),'            KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'ORTHOLOGY   ') || orthology==true
0247                     pathway=false;
0248                     module=false;
0249                     %Check if KO has been added already (each reaction may
0250                     %belong to several)
0251                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0252                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0253                     else
0254                         addToIndex=1;
0255                     end
0256                     
0257                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0258                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.orthology';
0259                     if strcmp(tline(13:16),'KO:')
0260                         %This is in the old version
0261                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(17:22);
0262                     else
0263                         %This means that it found one KO in the new format
0264                         %and that subsequent lines might be other KOs
0265                         orthology=true;
0266                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0267                     end
0268                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0269                 end
0270             end
0271             
0272             %Add pathways
0273             if numel(tline)>18
0274                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'PATHWAY     PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:18),'            PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'PATHWAY     ') || pathway==true
0275                     orthology=false;
0276                     module=false;
0277                     %Check if annotation has been added already
0278                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0279                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0280                     else
0281                         addToIndex=1;
0282                     end
0283                     
0284                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0285                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.pathway';
0286                     %If it's the old version
0287                     if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0288                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:25);
0289                     else
0290                         %If it's the new version
0291                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:19);
0292                         pathway=true;
0293                     end
0294                     
0295                     %Don't save global or overview pathways. The ids for
0296                     %such pathways begin with rn011 or rn012
0297                     if ~strcmp('rn011',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5)) && ~strcmp('rn012',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5))
0298                         model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0299                         
0300                         %Also save the subSystems names. For the old KEGG
0301                         %format, only the first mentioned subsystem is
0302                         %picked. Use the newer KEGG format to fetch all the
0303                         %subsystems
0304                         if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0305                             %The old format
0306                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter}=tline(28:end);
0307                         else
0308                             %The new format
0309                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1}{1,numel(model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1})+1}=tline(22:end);
0310                         end
0311                     end
0312                 end
0313             end
0314         end
0315         
0316         %Close the file
0317         fclose(fid);
0318         
0319         %This is done here since the the indexes won't match since some
0320         %reactions are removed along the way
0321         isIncomplete=model.rxns(isIncomplete);
0322         isGeneral=model.rxns(isGeneral);
0323         isSpontaneous=model.rxns(isSpontaneous);
0324 
0325         %If too much space was allocated, shrink the model
0326         model.rxns=model.rxns(1:rxnCounter);
0327         model.rxnNames=model.rxnNames(1:rxnCounter);
0328         model.eccodes=model.eccodes(1:rxnCounter);
0329         equations=equations(1:rxnCounter);
0330         model.rxnMiriams=model.rxnMiriams(1:rxnCounter);
0331         model.rxnNotes=model.rxnNotes(1:rxnCounter);
0332         model.subSystems=model.subSystems(1:rxnCounter);
0333         
0334         %Then load the equations from another file. This is because the
0335         %equations are easier to retrieve from there
0336         
0337         %The format is rxnID: equation The reactions should have been
0338         %loaded in the exact same order
0339         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'), 'r');
0340         
0341         %Loop through the file
0342         for i=1:rxnCounter
0343             %Get the next line
0344             tline = fgetl(fid);
0345             
0346             equations{i}=tline(9:end);
0347         end
0348         
0349         %Close the file
0350         fclose(fid);
0351         
0352         %Several equations may have two whitespaces between the last
0353         %reactant and the reversible arrow sign. The number of whitespaces
0354         %is thus reduced to one
0355         equations = regexprep(equations,'  <=>', ' <=>');
0356         
0357         %Construct the S matrix and list of metabolites
0358         [S, mets, badRxns]=constructS(equations);
0359         model.S=S;
0360         model.mets=mets;
0361         
0362         %There is some limited evidence for directionality in
0363         %reaction_mapformula.lst. The information there concerns how the
0364         %reactions are drawn in the KEGG maps. If a reaction is
0365         %irreversible in the same direction for all maps, then I consider
0366         %is irreversible, otherwise reversible. Also, not all reactions are
0367         %present in the maps, so not all will have directionality. They
0368         %will be considered to be reversible
0369         
0370         %The format is R00005: 00330: C01010 => C00011 Generate a
0371         %reversibility structure with the fields: *rxns: reaction ids
0372         %*product: one met id that is a product. This is because the
0373         %*reactions might be written in another direction compared to in
0374         % the reactions.lst file
0375         %*rev: 1 if reversible, otherwise 0
0376         reversibility.rxns={};
0377         reversibility.product={};
0378         reversibility.rev=[];
0379         
0380         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'), 'r');
0381         while 1
0382             %Get the next line
0383             tline = fgetl(fid);
0384             
0385             %Abort at end of file
0386             if ~ischar(tline)
0387                 break;
0388             end
0389             
0390             rxn=tline(1:6);
0391             prod=tline(end-5:end);
0392             rev=any(strfind(tline,'<=>'));
0393             if isempty(reversibility.rxns)
0394                 reversibility.rxns{1}=rxn;
0395                 reversibility.product{1}=prod;
0396                 reversibility.rev(1)=rev;
0397             elseif strcmp(reversibility.rxns(end),rxn)
0398                 %Check if the reaction was added before. It's an ordered
0399                 %list, so only check the last element If it's reversible in
0400                 %the new reaction or reversible in the old reaction then
0401                 %set (keep) to be reversible
0402                 if rev==1 || reversibility.rev(end)==1
0403                     reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0404                 else
0405                     %This means that the reaction was already loaded, that
0406                     %it was irreversible before and irreversible in the new
0407                     %reaction. However, it could be that they are written
0408                     %in diferent directions. If the product differ, then
0409                     %set to be reversible. This assumes that the reactions
0410                     %are written with the same metabolite as the last one
0411                     %if they are in the same direction
0412                     if ~strcmp(prod,reversibility.product(end))
0413                         reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0414                     end
0415                 end
0416             else
0417                 reversibility.rxns=[reversibility.rxns;rxn];
0418                 reversibility.product=[reversibility.product;prod];
0419                 reversibility.rev=[reversibility.rev;rev];
0420             end
0421         end
0422         fclose(fid);
0423         
0424         %Update the reversibility
0425         model.rev=ones(rxnCounter,1);
0426         %Match the reaction ids
0427         irrevIDs=find(reversibility.rev==0);
0428         [~, I]=ismember(reversibility.rxns(irrevIDs),model.rxns);
0429         [~, prodMetIDs]=ismember(reversibility.product(irrevIDs),model.mets);
0430         model.rev(I)=0;
0431         
0432         %See if the reactions are written in the same order in model.S
0433         linearInd=sub2ind(size(model.S), prodMetIDs, I);
0434         changeOrder=I(model.S(linearInd)<0);
0435         %Change the order of these reactions
0436         model.S(:,changeOrder)=model.S(:,changeOrder).*-1;
0437         
0438         %Add some stuff to get a correct model structure
0439         model.ub=ones(rxnCounter,1)*1000;
0440         model.lb=model.rev*-1000;
0441         model.c=zeros(rxnCounter,1);
0442         model.b=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0443         model=removeReactions(model,badRxns,true,true);
0444         
0445         %Identify reactions with undefined stoichiometry. Such
0446         %reactions involve metabolites with an ID containing the letter "n"
0447         %or "m"
0448         I=cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'n')) | cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'m'));
0449         [~, J]=find(model.S(I,:));
0450         isUndefinedStoich=model.rxns(unique(J));   
0451         %Sort model that metabolites with undefined stoichiometry would
0452         %appear in the end of metabolites list
0453         metList=[model.mets(~I);model.mets(I)];
0454         [~,metIndexes]=ismember(metList,model.mets);
0455         model=permuteModel(model,metIndexes,'mets');
0456         
0457         %Sort model that i) spontaneous, ii) with undefined
0458         %stoichiometry, iii) incomplete and iv) general reactions would bve
0459         %ranked in the end of the model
0460         endRxnList=unique([model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isUndefinedStoich));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isIncomplete));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isGeneral))],'stable');
0461         rxnList=[model.rxns(~ismember(model.rxns,endRxnList));endRxnList];
0462         [~,rxnIndexes]=ismember(rxnList,model.rxns);
0463         model=permuteModel(model,rxnIndexes,'rxns');
0464         
0465         %Add information in rxnNotes, whether reaction belongs to any of
0466         %type i-iv mentioned a few lines above
0467         for i=(numel(rxnList)-numel(endRxnList)+1):numel(model.rxns)
0468             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isSpontaneous)
0469                 model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Spontaneous');
0470             end
0471             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isUndefinedStoich)
0472                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0473                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'With undefined stoichiometry');
0474                 else
0475                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', with undefined stoichiometry');
0476                 end
0477             end
0478             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isIncomplete)
0479                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0480                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Incomplete');
0481                 else
0482                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', incomplete');
0483                 end
0484             end
0485             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isGeneral)
0486                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0487                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'General');
0488                 else
0489                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', general');
0490                 end
0491             end
0492             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),' reaction');
0493         end
0494         
0495         %Save the model structure
0496         save(rxnsFile,'model','isGeneral','isIncomplete','isUndefinedStoich','isSpontaneous');
0497     end
0498 end
0499 
0500 end
